Insides - Jon Hopkins, Imogen Heap - Ellipse, Mayer Hawthorne - a strange arrangement. It has been a good year for music.
Sweet Billy Pilgrim - Twice Born Men - my number one. Everything I could want in a record.
James Yorkston - Folk Songs - real, first take folk from the early days of the British Isles.
Fever Ray - Fever Ray - the girl from The Knife getting deeper, weirder and even more brilliant.
Lisa Papineau - Red Trees - heard about her from Gilles P's Brownswood Bubblers comp, the whole album is wonderful and very original.
Dam Funk - Toeachizown - So many good releases from Stones Throw this year. Real, synth funk, like Prince used to do, but deeper.
Norah Jones - The Fall - a bold step, great sounds, great songs, doing what is not expected, I know where she is coming from.
Dirty Projectors - Bitte Orca - This took a while, thought it was too obtuse at first, but stuck with it and realised I was wrong!
Oh No - Ethiopium - Madlib's younger brother remixes and rewrites the music of Ethiopia.
Kurt Elling - Dedicated to you - The greatest living jazz singer sings the music of Coltrane and Jonny Hartman. Perfection.
David Sylvian - Manofon - Difficult but massively rewarding music.
Volcano Choir - Unmap - Justin Vernon of Bon Iver joins these pop experimentalists. I thought it was a Midlake album cos of the front cover!
Karen O's score for Where the wild things are has been played endlessly.
Grizzly Bear - Veckatimist - The gig with the LSO at the Barbican was also my fave show of the year. Layer upon layer of melody & complexity
Tom Cawley and Kit Downes - Homely - 2 of the UKs finest piano players, playing with each other. Beauty ensues.
Phoenix - Wolfgang Amadeus Phoenix is probably my most played record.
Will post favourites of the year as I listen to them - first up Mulatu Astatke and The Heliocentrics! Incredible album.
